title: What Science Knows Now About the Risk of Covid-19 Transmission on Planes
sub_head: New research has uncovered when chances are higher, including during meal service. Overall risks appear to remain relatively low, but newer variants may change that equation.
body:
Fliers have yearned for reliable data on the risks of air travel since the pandemic began. Recent research on Covid-19 transmission on flights suggests that airlines could adopt new policies to better protect their passengers.
Scientists have found a sharp increase in possible spread during in-flight meal service when everyone has masks off. Theyâ€™ve also learned more about the importance of precautions during boarding and deplaning.
